Node.definition: = female bovine; ► clean animal
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
exact meaning uncertain but likely = a pointed object used as a tool to pierce or attach to an animal or object; ≈ associated with control
= pertaining to being the last remaining within a range of objects

= small, curved piece of metal or bone or even a strong thorn, with a sharp point on one end, usually with a barb just behind the point, and a loop or bend on the other end to which a fishing line can be attached; ► used with some bait attached to it in order to attract a fish; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= act of catching fish

= large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= referent to each member of a group of objects of the feminine grammatical gender
= unknown region
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= town and cult centre, also referred to as Beth Aven (בֵּית אָוֶן) or simply Aven (אָוֶן) ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) near the border of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement

= location; ◄ close to Jericho (יְרִחֹו) ► first camp of Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after crossing the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) here they set up twelve stones as a monument; it later became the location of a cultic center
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= state in which a countable entity is three in number

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
= state in which food has become sour;= ◄ due to the addition of sourdough or leaven during the production process
literally: thanksgiving; hence: = a sacrifice offered as a token of thankfulness
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement
= something offered to God as a free gift without any obligation
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= marker pointing out that the information that follows represents the logical consequence of what has been stated before
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: cleanness of teeth; hence: = state of being without food

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which humans are in lack of something that they are supposed to have
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
particle linking an event to a participant; = relation indicating that event X is focused on object Y
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= marker pointing out that the information that follows represents the logical consequence of what has been stated before
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= water that has fallen as rain
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= causative action by which a deity causes water to come down from the sky

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= causative action by which a deity causes water to come down from the sky
= object that is owned by someone; ◄ usually with the underlying assumption that it has been shared out to that person (or his ancestors) in the past
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= causative action by which a deity causes water to come down from the sky
= object that is owned by someone; ◄ usually with the underlying assumption that it has been shared out to that person (or his ancestors) in the past
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which a deity causes water to come down from the sky
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= state in which a countable entity is three in number

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
particle linking an event to a participant; = relation indicating that event X is focused on object Y
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: scorching; hence: = a plant disease with symptoms like sudden and severe yellowing, browning, spotting, withering, or dying of leaves, flowers, fruit, stems, or the entire plant
= destructive growth of minute fungi on plants; ≈ usually regarded as punishment from God
= a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)

= a tree that reaches a height of 5 8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree

= tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈ regarded as beautiful and associated with well being
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
particle linking an event to a participant; = relation indicating that event X is focused on object Y
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength
= causative action by which people, animals, or objects are forcibly carried off; ► in the case of people, into slavery or exile

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
literally: to cause to come up; hence: = causative process by which an activity is caused to increase in intensity
= process by which dead animals, plants, or wounds give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= part of the body projecting above the mouth on the face of a person or animal, containing the two nostrils
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
particle linking an event to a participant; = relation indicating that event X is focused on object Y
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities destroy an object completely ◄ as if by turning it completely upside down
= causative action by which humans or deities destroy an object completely ◄ as if by turning it completely upside down
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ located near Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) ► town where Lot (לֹוט) settled, when he separated himself from Abram (אַבְרָם) destroyed with Gomorrah (עֲמֹרָה)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ located near Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) ►destroyed with Sodom (סְדֹם)
= piece of wood; ► used for making fire
= causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
particle linking an event to a participant; = relation indicating that event X is focused on object Y
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= action where humans make themselves ready for a particular activity
= action by which humans purposefully move in the direction of (another) human, deity, or object to engage with them
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= state of absence of daylight; ≈ associated with death

= action by which someone move their feet with force on a surface or object, usually in a repetitive way ► which causes an effect on the surface or object whereupon it happens; ≈ associated with aggression and control
literally: the back (of an area); hence: = the highest situated parts of a certain location, often representing the entire location

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
